biotools.summary: CNVer is a method for CNV detection that supplements the depth-of-coverage with paired-end mapping information, where matepairs mapping discordantly to the reference serve to indicate the presence of variation. CNVer combines this information within a unified computational framework called the donor graph, allowing it to better mitigate the sequencing biases that cause uneven local coverage.
